content.description:
IMAGE 1: MASJID AL-HARAM OR GREAT MOSQUE, MECCA

© ayazad/Shutterstock.com

IMAGE 2: KOTEL, WAILING WALL, OR WESTERN WALL, JERUSALEM

© dbimages / Alamy # B7B7FH

Pilgrimage is commonly practiced by religious followers around the world. Each year, millions of pilgrims travel to pilgrimage locations in other countries.
content.question:
A. Using the location shown in Image 1, describe the pilgrimage location in terms of a culture hearth.

B. Explain how an ethnic religion is likely to have an effect on the number of international pilgrimage locations.

C. Using the location shown in Image 2, explain how large pilgrimages can create a centrifugal force for a religious group.

D. Explain ONE way that distance decay accounts for spatial patterns of international travel to pilgrimage locations.

E. Explain ONE way that international pilgrimages can affect the territoriality of the government that claims control of a pilgrimage site.
